newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Newcrest sees 14 day Telfer scale-back.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Newcrest sees 14 day Telfer scale-back.

text.p: Newcrest Mining Ltd said gold mining activities at its Telfer gold mine in the Great Sandy Desert of Western Australia would be scaled-down for at least two weeks due to fuel supply problems caused by heavy rainfall.

"Full mining activities, assuming no further rainfall, will not be capable of resumption in less than 14 days. Until road access is re-established it will not be possible to determine the extent, if any, to which gold production is impacted," the company said.
Newcrest said the temporary reduction would allow it to conserve distillate and to continue ore treatment activities.

"This action has become necessary because run-off following persistent rainfall has cut the mine access road for the last five weeks. Heavy duty maintenance, all non-core and some open pit mining activities will cease until road access is re-established."
Gold production at Telfer in the 1996/97 second quarter was 95,739 ounces, a fall of three percent on the year ago level and due to lower than expected oxide mill grades.
The company said on January 29 that this problem was a key factor behind its latest forecast that it might achieve only a break-even profit result in the 1996/97 second half.
Newcrest recorded a pre-tax loss of A$4.8 million before abnormal items in the second quarter ended December 31, last year. Its shares were 10 cents higher at A$5.35 at 3.50 p.m. (0450 GMT).
